thread.title: Report: UGA adds JUCO coach to offensive staff
thread.title_full: Report: UGA adds JUCO coach to offensive staff

title: Report: UGA adds JUCO coach to offensive staff
text:
Report: UGA adds JUCO coach to offensive staff Georgia has filled the vacancy left by the departure of D.J. Looney to Mississippi State last week. 
Georgia has reportedly filled the need for a graduate assistant to help with the offensive line. According to FootballScoop.com , Itawamba College (Itawamba, Miss.) offensive line coach Will Peagler is headed to Athens to aid Sam Pittman and the Bulldogs. 
Peagler replaces D.J. Looney, who left for a job at his alma mater, Mississippi State, last week. Not a member? For a limited time, buy one month of Dawgs247 VIP, get two months FREE! 
A Clemson graduate, Peagler coached tight ends at Valdosta State in 2010. He has also had stops at Louisiana-Lafayette (offensive quality control and graduate assistant), Coffeyville Community College (JUCO - offensive line coach), and Minnesota (offensive quality control). 
In 2016 Itawamba was 16th in all of the NJCAA in scoring at over 36 points per game. Itawamba also had the nation's second-best passing attack at over 393 yards per game and second-best rushing attack at 169.3 yards per game. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
